column4: i am in this stage of installation where the ubuntu cannot detect my disk drive and it has asked me to select the driver from the list. i do not know the driver of my disk. what should i do?
phqu , can you explain more?
i am in this stage of installation where the ubuntu cannot detect my disk drive and it has asked me to select the driver from the list. i do not know the driver of my disk. what should i do?
phqu, where would i find AHCI??
how can i access the setting in the bios?
what button should i press?
phqu what button should i press or where is the setting found in the bios?
i access the setup bios on f2
but i am in it
i cannot find AHCI
next time copy down the choices it gives you and print them here.
copy down the choices it gives you and type them in this channel. capiche?
how big? how many drivers?
what I said... 8 )
you can pastebin them. !pastebin | mib_mkjis0wo
you'll have to hand copy them to pastebin
it would help if you knew the mfg of the drive you are trying to find. Do you know that or can find out?
does it boot at all, or it is trying to find the drive to boot from?
I am still not sure what the problem is? Does it boot off of the disk in the cdrom?
ok, then what drive is it trying to find a driver for? the hard drive?
well, you need to write down exactly what the error message says. Ubuntu is usu. good in provinding info to solve a problem. ( unlike some other os's).
